perturbation.original_text:
This Customization Schedule is attached to the Software License, Customization and Maintenance Agreement (the "Agreement") executed by and between Bank of America, N.A. ("Bank of America") and <<enter Company Name>> ("Supplier"). The Customizations identified hereunder shall be subject to the terms and conditions of that Software License, Customization and Maintenance Agreement referenced above.

Bank of America wishes to obtain the Customizations herein defined, and Supplier wishes to delivery those Customizations, on the terms and conditions of the Agreement and this Customization Schedule.
perturbation.changed_text:
This Customization Schedule is attached to the Software License, Customization and Maintenance Agreement (the "Agreement") executed by and between Bank of America, N.A. ("Bank of America") and <<enter Company Name>> ("Vendor"). The Customizations identified hereunder shall be subject to the terms and conditions of that Software License, Customization and Maintenance Agreement referenced above.

Bank of America wishes to obtain the Customizations herein defined, and Supplier wishes to delivery those Customizations, on the terms and conditions of the Agreement and this Customization Schedule.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Supplier' and 'Vendor' are used seemingly interchangeably, which causes confusion as to the exact legal entity that is contracted to fulfill the obligations of the agreement. This creates uncertainty regarding who is ultimately responsible for delivery of customizations.

perturbation.original_text: If the proposed price Is Increased by Supplier upon delivery to Bank of America of detailed specifications or at any other time hereafter, Bank of America may terminate this Schedule and shall receive a refund of all amounts previously paid hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: If the proposed price Is Increased by Vendor upon delivery to Bank of America of detailed specifications or at any other time hereafter, Bank of America may terminate this Schedule and shall receive a refund of all amounts previously paid hereunder.
perturbation.explanation: Changing from 'Supplier' to 'Vendor' can cause issues if the contract does not clearly define if both terms refer to the same legal entity. This introduces potential ambiguity, especially if separate entities are acting as supplier and vendor at different stages. This contradicts the first perturbation, therefore, introduces a contradiction.

perturbation.original_text:
Bank of America Project Administrator:   Supplier Project Administrator:



 Bank of America Project Manager:   Supplier Project Manager:
perturbation.changed_text:
Bank of America Project Administrator:   Contractor Project Administrator:



 Bank of America Project Manager:   Contractor Project Manager:
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Supplier' and 'Contractor' are used, creating ambiguity about which entity handles project administration and management. While the original contract begins using 'Supplier,' switching to 'Contractor' without proper definition introduces uncertainty, contradicting previous uses of Supplier.
